cyclone.name: DORIAN
cyclone.current_location: about 110 miles east of Cape Canaveral, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: The hurricane is moving northwest tonight, then is forecast to turn north and parallel the Florida east coast before heading toward the coasts of Georgia and the Carolinas.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: South- or North-Carolina coast (near the SC/NC border)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch north of Ponte Vedra Beach FL to Savannah River GA and north of Surf City NC to the NC/VA border; Tropical Storm Watch Chesapeake Bay south of Smith Point; Storm Surge Watch north of Surf City NC to Duck NC including sounds and rivers.
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning Sebastian Inlet FL to Ponte Vedra Beach FL and from north of Savannah River to Surf City NC; Tropical Storm Warning Jupiter Inlet FL to Sebastian Inlet FL and north of Ponte Vedra Beach FL to Savannah River GA; Storm Surge Warning Jupiter Inlet FL to Surf City NC.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeastern U.S. coast from just north of West Palm Beach FL through Georgia, South Carolina and North Carolina.
weather_observation.wind: Outer rainbands could bring occasional tropical-storm-force gusts (30–40 mph) but sustained gale conditions are unlikely.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge of 1–2 ft possible along exposed Broward County beaches; significant inundation not expected at the port.
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches of rainfall possible in squalls; localized heavier pockets in outer bands.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Hazardous surf and life-threatening rip currents along the southeast Florida beaches could disrupt small-craft and pilot-boat operations.
